page.title: 06BARSHILL
page.content: Barshill is an upland farm of two hundred and sixty six acres and is privately owned by the Marshall family. More than half of the land is rented out to other farmers for grazing. The Marshall's themselves use the rest of the land for grazing their one hundred and fifty sheep. They also have six cows, three collies, two kittens and a cat. The Marshall's have farmed Barshill for fifty four years. On their land they have an old Iron Age Fort. On this site, they cannot plough or grow anything apart from grass. At one time, the government paid them for the up keep of the fort but this does not happen any longer.
